Description: Handle and wall fragment from large pottery cup(?); interior glazed, and top of handle; exterior, handle zone reserved, painted below. Dense brown-reddish clay, hard, with a fair amount of lime inclusions and some small mica.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.859)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.6013 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
